Description: This element creates an Active Directory forest with a single site and a single domain controller. The Domain Administrator password will be the one set by this template.

DomainControllerID.Description: Instance ID of the Domain Controller

ADDomainAdminPw.Description: Password for the domain admin user. Must be at least 8 characters containing letters, numbers and symbols

ADDomainDNSName.Description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the forest root domain e.g. example.com

ADRestoreModePw.Description: Password for a separate Administrator account when the domain controller is in Restore Mode. Must be at least 8 characters containing letters, numbers and symbols

CIDRPrivateSubnet.Description: CIDR Block for a Private Subnet (Example: 10.0.0.0/19, 10.0.64.0/19, etc...)

CIDRPublicSubnet.Description: CIDR Block for a Public DMZ Subnet (Example: 10.0.32.0/20, 10.0.96.0/20, etc...)

CIDRVPC.Description: CIDR Block for the VPC (Example: 10.0.0.0/16, etc...)

DcComputerName.Description: NetBIOS computer name of the Domain Controller(Example: dc001, dc002, dc003, etc...)

DcInstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the Domain Controller Instance

DcPrivateIp.Description: Fixed private IP for the Domain Controller instance (e.g. 10.0.0.10, 10.0.64.10, etc...)

DcSecurityGroupId.Description: ID of the security group for domain controllers

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

PrivateSubnetId.Description: Subnet ID for the Private Subnet where the AD Domain Controller instance will run

RemoteAccessUserGroup.Description: Domain group that will be used to authorize users to connect via the RDGW
